p: In food production, inhibiting the growth of microorganisms through the use of socially acceptable preservatives is a serious problem. Societyâ€™s reluctance to use antibiotics and synthetic preservatives, such as benzoic acid, sorbic acid, lactic acid, propionic acid, acetic acid, and its derivatives, parabens or inorganic sulfites, nitrites, and nitrates, necessitates finding alternative solutions [ 9]. This may be an application for EOs, especially since chemical preservatives cannot eliminate several pathogenic bacteria, such as Listeria monocytogenes, in food products or delay the growth of spoilage microorganisms. In addition, natural products are inherently better tolerated in the human body, usually with fewer side effects [ 10].
